questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

choices.B: To check the MAC address from server 7/4 interface eth10, you can check the MAC addresses learned on veth 1866 on fabric interconnect B.
choices.C: The option failover is enabled on all the interfaces.
choices.E: Interface vfc 1871 is pinned to fc interface 1/32 in fabric interconnect B.
choices.D: The server has total of six vNICs.
choices.A: Server 7 in chassis 4 has been associated with the profile circuit.

discussion.content: changed my opinion: the fc ports are not protected and if they do not count against te vnic count answer options B+D are correct.
A, D, E are incorrect, so B+C are the best answers

questions.question_text: Which request obtains the switchname, in JSON format, from a Cisco Nexus device via the NX-API?

discussion.content: what exactly are the answer options ?

Disjoint L2 networks are supported in EHM from UCSM V2.0. Answers D+E are wrong.

Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/unified-computing/white_paper_c11-692008.html

BC are corrects:

The end-host mode is the default mode of operation for UCS Fabric Interconnect Ethernet connectivity. In this mode, UCS Fabric Interconnect is presented to the northbound LAN switch as an end host with many adapters. STP is not configured on the uplink switch ports.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about UCS switch mode are true? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Ethernet switching mode must be used only if the fabric interconnect is connected directly to a router. BC
choices.B: Server-to-server multicast and broadcast traffic is sent through all uplink ports in the same VLAN.
choices.C: Broadcast packets flood out of all ports except the port that it was received on.
choices.D: Switch mode is the default Ethernet switching mode.
choices.A: Disjoint Layer 2 networks are supported only when the Ethernet switching mode of the fabric interconnects is configured for switch mode.

questions.question_text: Which method is the best way to troubleshoot a specific workflow execution in UCSD?

discussion.content: B. Check the specific SR log.

choices.D: Generate techsupport and submit it to the TAC workflow analysis tool.
choices.A: Enable debug log first, then check the infrastructure logs.

questions.question_text: How many APICs can you communicate with at one time in a single REST call using Postman?

discussion.content: agree, one APIC at a time as the URL has to be entered for Postman
I think one APIC at a time.
